item.title: How to save the state of a KVM/qemu VM
item.description: How to save the state of a running KVM/qemu VM Virtualbox and VMWare player have a nice feature that lets you “pause” a VM and save its state/memory to disk. Here’s how to do that with KVM. List your running VMs $ virsh list Id Name State -------------------------------- 6 php_sandbox.1 running 13 website running $ “Suspend” the VM $ virsh managedsave php_sandbox.1 Domain php_sandbox.1 state saved by libvirt $ The managedsave command will take some time as it copies the VM’s RAM to disk.

item.title: Disabling screen blanking in Ubuntu 20.04
item.description: How to disable screen blanking in Ubuntu 20.04 After disabling my screensaver and lockscreen on a KVM/qemu virtual machine, I noticed the screen would still go blank after a period of inactivity. Sometimes this resulted in the X server crashing with the following error in the syslog: spice-vdagent[2223]: Unable to find a display id for output index 1) This script uses the xset preferences utility to set blanking off and disables the DPMS energy features.
